Reviews.Title: “So and So”
Reviews.Author: Karakaxaki
Reviews.Content: Travel in April 2012. Couple The Hotel is located at Taksim square, which means that you are 15 minutes (by tram) from most of "worth to see" monuments. Room was clean, but not something special The view of our room is just the opposite building Staff in the restaurant was helpfull. The service in the reception was depended on the person that was in charge. Some of them were helpful, some of them not. The breakfast is quite ok and the breakfast hall has a nice view, since it is located on the Top of the hotel. Concluding I would say that the hotel is not a top choice but on the other had is not bad. I could stay again, but Iâ€™m not keen about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toto79beirut
Reviews.Content: i have stayed twice in this hotel - summer 2010 and Dec2011, beside the perfect location of this hotel.. very good service and Calm quiet Clean and Friendly Staff.......also v good and fresh breakfast :) i will always make it as my choice whenever i got to istanbul. the only thing i think they should do is to have SPA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location ,very good service, good price”
Reviews.Author: AhmadIsmail
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 5days 4 nights and honestly i'll come back again to coz of its excellent location less than 5min walking to istiklal street and taksim square, the view from our window in the 7th floor not bad but there's is a big building seems like a bank on the other side of the street the service was acceptable the air condition was so good all over the hotel, the free internet keep disconnected dont know why!! our room was wide and big i think , the extended sofa we asked for its good but it keeps closed so we need to open again. The staff was friendly i faced some problems talking to them coz not all of them can speak any other language than their Turkish. the hotel location and price is worth to saty in.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: SamahCairo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 6 days, the beauty about the hotel is that it is so close to Taksim square and Istiqlal street that are the heart of shopping, entertainment and also a main station for public transportation that can take one anywhere. Hotel is very convenient, clean, safe and well organized. Though staff are not very hospitable, yet they do all what is required. Rooms are cleaned properly and consistently. Restaurant where breakfast is served is vey nice and big, yet breakfast is the same all days and lacks variety. Feronya is a very good convenient hotel if what you need from the hotel is cleanliness and comfort besides being very close to all what one can need.

Reviews.Title: “clean, small. but bad view and bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Amro B
Reviews.Content: I spent there 3 nights with my wife, when I got to the hotel I was shocked by the bad view when I opened the window in the 4th floor, you can only see a big building on the other side of the street, and it seems to be a headquarter of a national bank, so yo will have zero privacy if yo dare to open the curtains, when I complainted to the guest relations they gave me a room in the 6th floor, so there was no difference except that it was a little bit higher and they told me that they only have this side or another side tha faces a wall, so I had no other choice than to take the room and since I was there for sight seeing and shoping I didnt change the hotel rooms are so clean but so small. ventolation system is somehow noisy staff there arent so friendly at all, they are more like robots, they have god knowledge if the city streets and sights, but they rarely smilr, and when they do they make you feel that they programed to smile food there is so clean and the restaurant on the 9th floor is the only plave you will have there to find a good view, we didnt pay much there anyway so we think that the service level is logi givien the price you pay yor biggest advantege there will be the location m it is 5 minutes walking from Isteklal st, and 2 minutes walking fromTaksim square

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Amookhteh
Reviews.Content: I got there on the 21st of January 2012 and stayed there for four days I didn't have a good time there and don't consider it a four star at all. It is an average three star maximum. The breakfast is quite limited and lacks the variety of a four star hotel. Secondly, the facilities of the bedroom are quite dated and limited too. There is a very small bath in which you can hardly turn around with the ever-changing water temperature which turns your shower into a nightmare. The receptionists gave me a hard time at my arrival, keeping us waiting for more than an hour while giving rooms to the guests coming long after us just because they were a tour of fifteen people. Besides you rarely see a bellman or anyone even telling you hi at your entrance to the hotel. The staff are not even helpful when you ask them a question. So I don't recommend it to anyone at all. However the only good thing about this hotel is it's location which is quite close to Taksim Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramezawy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my vacation period very much specially in Feronya Hotel ,, the room was clean and tide ,,, the breakfast meal was just fine although there were no much varieties ,,, the room service staff were so friendly ,,, but the reception staff were so rude and not friendly at all ,, i extended my visit for one more night with my reservation company but i found out the reception desk is not allowing me to use my room anymore for the last night pretending that there are no free rooms anymore ,,, so i called my reservation company to fix up this issue and they contacted the hotel soon ,, so the reception man just apologized for me and then returned the entry card back to me ,,,

Reviews.Title: “Good location,Resonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Parisa A
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 7 night, the location is so perfect,good restaurants are around the hotel.from hotel to Taksim square and Istiqlal avenue just takes 5 min by walk.The room service is also nice,every day after our return to the hotel our room has been cleaned. Breakfast time i also long so you dont have to be worry if you want to sleep a little longer.The breakfast is including everything. We didnt have a view from our room as the hotel is surrended by other hotels and high building, but all hotels in this area are the same, but you can have a nice view when you are having breakfast as the buffet is in 9th floor. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Po87
Reviews.Content: i went in a double room with my friend to spend one night, the room was ok, clean and convenient, a bit small but who cares, we were out all day... The Location is EXCELLEEEENT, within 2 minutes walking from Taksim Square -down town- in a calm neighbourhood. very safe. the breakfast wasn't that good, i enjoyed breakfast soooo much more at Crystal Hotel in Taksim Square. But overall I recommend you to go there, great value for money and excellent location, what else would you look for if you are on a tight budget??? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Semo2011
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay there, staff is helpful, the hotel is clean,quiet. The breakfast is delicious. The location is perfect, so near to Taksim square. The rooms are so tight. Internet is free. I really recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cp_0010
Reviews.Content: We had booked a double room for 4 nights in Sept 2009. Our stay was great, the hotel is located in Taksim area and all tourist attractions are well connected. Our room was spacious, clean and breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. Hotel staff very nice and helpful. There are lots of restaurants available nearby and also cafes, money exchange shops, bus stand , metro station etc.. At Taksim square, you have to take a funicular to reach metro station and from there all places of tourist attractions can be reached.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean , very rude !!!”
Reviews.Author: FouTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very clean , Breakfast is very good But u can smell smoke every where , stuff are very rude don't understand ur english don't want to help

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: vafa62
Reviews.Content: At first I have to say don't compare Istanbul hotels with other countries hotels. I stayed there for one week and I really enjoyed that. It is near Taksim Square and you can find everything nearby_ restaurants, cafes, exchange shops, metro station, bus station, taxis ,â€¦â€¦._ Istiklal street also is near. (One of the most famous streets in Istanbul that you can enjoy the restaurants, cafes, lots of shops and â€¦â€¦) Hotel rooms are small but neat and clean. The staff are so friendly and helpful. We had a double room. The room facilities include a TV, small refrigerator, air conditioning, hair dryer and a safe box but don't forget to take your toothpaste and slippers! The breakfast was good but all days the same. I'll definitely book this hotel next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Impolite staff”
Reviews.Author: ShiyasKoya
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days.centrally located.. But thats the only plus point.. All the staff were very impolite.. Especially those in the front desk. Small rooms,.No pool,or any other amenities.. The food was just fine , but the staff again very arrogant.. Definitely a hotel not worth visiting again....

Reviews.Title: “Feronya Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: geektrvlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment after the others selected by Gate 1. The desk staff were rude and disinterested. The restaurant staff were downright nasty to a member of the group. You had to ask for toiletries and even toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Nicer Hotels in the Immediate Vicinity”
Reviews.Author: zacharyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Feronya as part of a tour itinerary. The hotel is certainly clean and well located but there are far nicer hotels just around the corner. The front desk staff tried their best to assist but could not supply the services of a concierge. I assume the room rates are very reasonable and that is why the hotel was chosen for our tour. Breakfast was more than adequate--we did not have any other meal at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: BourbonandTonic
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Istanbul. The first time I stayed at a hotel near the Blue Mosque and it was amazing. They advertised as a 4 star hotel and it definitely was. The Feronya awas lso advertised as a 4 star hotel, but there was a huge difference! The rooms were smaller than my dorm room in college. The beds were as hard as stone. The a/c wouldn't cool down the room - it took two visits my maintenance to get it working on the 2nd day of our visit. The worst part is that when we booked the room, the hotel asked us if we would like to upgrade - and we said yes. I am curious what the regular room would have looked like. Location was fantastic. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was good. I would recommend this hotel - but beware - their 4 star rating is subjective.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: defACB_Mayer
Reviews.Content: When I arrived first, I was very impressed by the service of the stuff. I was totally disorganized by the location of the hotel first, but afterwards it pointed out that the location was the best for my trip. The stuff was very helpful, for finding my way to many appointments and always organized a chauffeur. Clean, Internet connection and the best sleep after a while, that was what I needed and got. What I liked best, was the morning, with the nice breakfast and the friendly stuff. They still are working and serving, even when the breakfast is over. At least have to mention, even the owner, a very gentle lady, asked for my residence whether I liked it or not. That was very impressive for a local 4 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will return soon”
Reviews.Author: ArpiTreviso
Reviews.Content: With this message I want to thank the staff of Feronya Hotel! I had a great trip and with the kindness of the hotel staff, helping us out in difficult situations, it got even better. I loved your hotel, the food and the position and I will come again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Feronya Hotel Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Jalil-1970
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel' very good location, very clean, friendly staff..

Reviews.Title: “hotel needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: yelcay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Feronya in April. Hotel seems to cater to tour groups. It is well located and we had excellent breakfasts during our stay. However, service was spotty and rooms are in big need of refurbishing. if you have an alternative hotel in similar location, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Crap hotel, pathetic service and total lack of care towards customers”
Reviews.Author: steflaureil
Reviews.Content: During our initial stay this hotel had no food available after breakfast that could best be described as pathetic. Furthermore the time changed and they didn't bother to inform the guests, causing us to miss a show that we arrived for on time, but it turned out 1 hour late. In addition, the internet didn't work for a day and when I enquired they had no clue. Three days later after constant promises it still wasn't working. Then we left and had booked a room for our return. We return at midnight to be informed that they had given our room away and that they would put us up at another of their hotels. This turned out to be a shoebox and totally unacceptable. The Feronya's remedy was a suite next time we stayed there. Fat chance !

Reviews.Title: “not userfriendly at all!”
Reviews.Author: Chatoyancee
Reviews.Content: me ,my mom and dad,we stayed 4 nights there. so cool that the hotel is really feet away from taksim and shopping mall. as we were three we asked for a three bed room ,but my bed was an opened sofa,although it was ok. as the room had airconditioner but the room was cold,,,it could have had been becouse of the windows,the wind could get through out the window,,,,,the room had 2 windows but no light at all as it faced 2 meter away the back wall of an other hotel.and there was some repairing stuff up in 5th floor not letting me to have an afternoon nap with their hammer sounds!it was awful! i enjoyed bath and toilet,they were completely standard as it was small,but the water got cold and warm every minute,,,,,just okey for a 3 minute shower! the bar in the room was sooo small wich i couldnt fit my king burger's cheeseburger in it.just suitable for small bottled drinks. the sounds could get through the walls and roof as we got up of a couples shouting voice in the middle of the night.tv was ok,at least it had bbc! the reception is totally unpolite!they even cant smile and say hello!they really bothered me,,,, the breakfast was really good with a great view of istanbul but the tempreture was low and i had to get warm with my clothes.and the waiters has got a really bad habit!they check u all the time ,,,,i hate to be checked as im eating... but they can speak most languages and its really good :) the cleanliness was good but they had left no teethbrush,and no tissues in the room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair enough”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesknight
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel at 31st of december 2009 until 4th of January 2010.I was quite happy with the cleaningness of the hotel,but most of the rooms are very small.it defently needs to be refurnished and redecorated.so do not expect many things.The staff is fair helpful.The breakfast is good,and the location is excellent.It's only only 2 blocks from the taksim square!!!Finally the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: magistros
Reviews.Content: The location and the hotel was good, I had a pleasant stay. Nothing exciting but nothing to complain. Elite hotel (4+ star) which is next to Feronya is much more exciting. I do not know their prices.

Reviews.Title: “feronya - the travellodge of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nabeeldar
Reviews.Content: if you looking for a bed and breakfast, in taksim area - bit like a travellodge then this is fine, otherwise give it a big miss.....Location is good, rooms are OK , but the bathrooms are puny and uncomfortable so to speak. We were given a small room on the 8th floor first, with two twin beds ( not ideal for a couple !) i asked the receptionist if we could be allocated a room with a double/queen size bed. The next day I was given a room on the 6 floor, but this time the room was much larger...and they had stuck two single beds together to make a double bed....cant win can you ? ....the staff at the reception can do with smiling and being more helpful...i asked them several questions on nemerous occassions and were given blunt answers, like they were doing me a favour by replying.......i found the bar staff more talkative and helpful... our stay was for 10 nights,,and asked about a late check out (checkout is at 12 midday,,,i wanted to checkout at 4 PM), and was told by receptionist that I would have to pay 50 Euros for this - i replied back to him stating that considering i had paid Â£41 a night via my travelagent , why would i i pay 50 euros for four extra hours ? he once again looked at me, as though he was doing me a favour..... wirless internet access avaiable on all floors, breaky OK more or less the worst recpetionist staff you can imagine ;) for this reason i would never go back. -

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I am happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: ooDormouseoo
Reviews.Content: I had a nice room at the Hotel Feronya and was more than content with my stay there. I had been a little apprehensive as to what the quality of the place might be but my negative fears were not justified. The staff were more than helpful. There are several hotels of the same sort close to each other in this area and colleagues staying in them had equally positive experiences. Breakfast was upstairs in an airy environment where you could look out over part of the city. Tables with clean tablecloths and food well laid out were the order of the day. In summary I found nothing to fault this establishment and would be happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a 4 star hotel but one of the best of 4 stars in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 007-Tehran
Reviews.Content: It is not a 4 star hotel but one of the best of 4 stars in istanbul.the rooms are very clean but the staff are not so kindly especially the reception .All the rooms have no view.I have staied ther for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: pragasam
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel in the Taksim area of Istanbul. The public square near the hotel and the streets were a hive of activity as Turkey was playing Germany in the semi-finals of Euro 2008 the night that we arrived. Our bedroom window opened to the back wall of the adjoining building - absolutely no view but a wall 2 metres away and downpipes. However the room and bed were okay. We slept well. The toilet and bath were puny and uncomfortable. It was good for a change to be served at table by waiters in the dining room. The meal was well presented and tasty. John & Alice.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated in a Lively Area”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: Most tourists in Istanbul focus on two areas to stay: Sultanahmet and Taksim. I was advised to stay near Taksim and it was definitely the right choice. Although there is a lot to see in Sultanahmet it is limited in the evening and Taksim is much more lively. The hotel was a good choice; there are quite a few hotels in this area and they all look of a good standard. Our room was huge and had all the comforts. Breakfast was good (a few hot things) and staff were helpful. We got as good night's sleep every night. One one thing to bear in mind is there is a lot of building work, it didn't really affect us as the rooms had good sound proofing. The price was really good and I don't know if the neighbouring hotels could match what we payed. Everything was fine for us. To get to Sultanahmet we found the funicular and tram the quickest route (you can easily spend half a day sat on a bus in the terrible traffic). Also consider the ferries as they are cheap and there's no congestion!!

Reviews.Title: “Feronya Hotel, Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Houbie
Reviews.Content: The Feronya Hotel is one of many situated in the proximity of Taksim Square. It is within 5 minutes walking distance to Taksim Square, Istiklal Street and the Metro and Bus Stations. Although on a main road, it is quiet at night. The hotel is decorated in a modern yet retro fashion. Although the rooms are small, the hotel is very clean.....extremely important factor when choosing a place to stay. The breakfast room was also clean and organized and nicely deocrated. The breakfast itself was the same every day, but enough there to satisfy most appetites. Overall, if you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel and require many facilities, this hotel is a perfect stop to rest peacefully at night and feel safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, I guess”
Reviews.Author: MajorVoid
Reviews.Content: Well, it's a basic tourist hotel in a basic tourist area. I wouldn't call it a four star hotel by any standards. Nothing to write home about. Staff friendly. Room smallish and clean. Not particularly pleasant view of construction site. Reasonable value but I'm sure you could do better if you tried.

HotelInfo.Name: Feronya Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nispet Sk, 9 34437 Cumhuriyet Cd, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
